page.title: 05THE JOHN RADCLIFFE HOSPITAL.
page.content: On the{8}levels of the{J.R. II}there are{27}wards and{21}of them have about {20}beds each. The{J.R.I}has{7}levels containing general purpose wards,and an isolation unit. The{fourth ward}on level{7}is a {special care baby unit,}which is known worldwide for its facilities. The{J.R. has{ten}anaesthetic rooms for operations. The industrial part does{laundry}and provides services for the hospital's needs. There are{71}catering staff altogether in the{John Radcliffe,} making all three meals a day. At least once a year there is a fire lecture to all members of staff and the new medical students. The ambulances bringing patients in, each carry a{Life Pack 5}(a defibrillator-cardiac monitor) and a resuscitator monitor.
